div.p: THE MAN-CHILD BROUGHT FORTH IN US: OR GOD MANIFEST IN FLESH.
By JOHN LEWIN a member of the ARMY
div.q: 2. Cor. 13.5. Know yee not that Chriſt is in you, except yee be Reprobates.
div.p: LONDON, Printed for G C, at the weſt end of Paules.

div.head: THE MAN-CHJLD BROUGHT FORTH IN US: OR GOD MANIFST IN FLESH.

epigraph.q: For unto us a child is borne, vnto us a ſon is given; and the government ſhall be upon his ſhoulder: and his Name ſhall be called wonderfull, Counſeller, the mighty God, the everlaſting Father, the Prince of peace. And of the increaſe of his government and peace there ſhall be no end, &c.

div.p:
THIS propheſie or promiſe is of a child, a ſonne that ſhall be borne and given; which man-child, is God manifeſt in fleſh, in the fleſh of the Saints, as the Sonne; and then ſhall all theſe names be manifeſt
to be God in fleſh; wonderfull Counſeller, the mighty God, the everlaſting Father, the Prince of peace: And the loftineſſe of man ſhall be brought down, and the Lord alone exalted, in that day; this is for the comfort of Saints, ſuch as waite for God, the glory of the Sonne to be revealed in them; and this glory ſhall be before we be a ware: Iſa. 66.7. Before ſhee travelled, ſhee brought forth: before her pain came, ſhe was delivered of a man child. Which is the glory of the Son in the Saints, ſuch as wait for the appearance of God; and then all other glories ſhall be deſtroyed, all other but God; Iſaiah 66.1. Thus ſaith the Lord; The Heaven is my throne, and the earth is my foot-ſtoole: where is the houſe that yee build unto me? and where is the place of my reſt?

There were glorious houſes under the Law; and there were Churches under the Goſpell; and now Saints are much troubled and buſied about a houſe to God, and much at a loſſe in it, in their church-fellowſhips: Here ſaith God, Heaven is my throne, and the
Earth is my foot-ſtool, where is the houſe that ye will build to me? That God that fils all creatures, his glory fils the Saints: & ſince you are a houſe, but to this man will I looke, even to him that is poor & of a contrite ſpirit, there is the habitation of God.

All theſe formes have beene, and my hands hath made all theſe: But to this man will I looke. This ſhould take the people of God off from all formes and church-fellowſhips, and building of houſes to God; becauſe the weakeſt Saints, the leaſt Saint, are the habitation of God; a poor contrite ſpirit, broken into peeces, ground to powder, one that ſees no good in himſelfe, one that trembles at every word of God, theſe God dwels in, and they are the habitation of God; therefore who will build God a houſe? Iſa. 51.13, 14. He that puts his truſt in me; That is, he that waites for God, for the appearance of God, as in the next verſe, and ſhall ſay, caſt yee up, that is, prepare a way for the Lord, as men
doe when they prepare a way, they caſt up earth and ſtones, and ſo make a cauce-way for paſſing; and ſo ſaith the Lord, caſt yee up, that is prepare for him, waite for him, and take away all ſtumblings, as men doe all blocks when they prepare a way; that the Lord may dwell amongſt us, what then? Hee ſhal poſſeſſe the land, and inherit my holy mountaine, what's that? Jer. 31.23. He ſhall call thee the habitation of Juſtice, and mountaine of holineſſe: So that Saints are the mountain of God; and the Tabernacle of God is amongſt the ſonnes of men: There be many lets and ſtumblings that doe hinder the appearance of God, not in reſpect of outward formes, Church fellowſhips; but in our own ſpirits; wee thinke it wonderfull that God ſhould dwell in fleſh, mortall fleſh, ſinfull fleſh; and other lets there are wich doe much hinder the way of God, or a manifeſtation of God in us: but God ſaith in the 15. verſe of that 56. of Iſa. Thus faith the high and lofty one that inhabiteth eternity, whoſe name is holy, I
dwell in the high and holy place, with him alſo that is of an humble and contrite ſpirit: that is, that God which dwels on high, in the lofty place, the holy one, the high one, he dwels in the contrite one, though he be high; yea in the weakeſt Saints, though they ſeeme to be quite dead.

Now when God is manifeſt in us, then his name ſhall appeare to be wonderfull, when the Man child is brought forth in us, his name ſhall be called wonderfull in us, in his appearance, his name ſhall be read wonderfull in the fore-heads of the Saints, when he appeares: David when he comes to ſee God filling all places, and all creatures, and all as one to God, he magnifies him, and ſaies, Whether ſhall he goe frrm God; in the 139. Pſalme 13, 14. ver. For thou haſt poſſeſſed my reins, thou haſt covered me in my Mothers womb. I will praiſe thee, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made, marvelous are thy workes and that my ſoule knoweth right well. That is, that God that fils all, and is wonderfull in all
whither ſhall I goe from God? I am wonderfully made: which is the appearance of God in him. And in the 12. of the Revel. 1. There appeared a wonder in Heaven, a woman being with child, cryed to be delivered: This woman here now that is ſpoken of in Heaven, it is the Saints who are in the Spirit, that waite for the appearance of God in them; and this is called a wonder: his name ſhall be called wonderfull; his name ſhall be called wonderfull to others; God in us ſhall. In the 13. of the Acts 41. Behold you deſpiſers, and wonder, and periſh: I worke a worke in your daies which yee ſhall not beleeve, though a man even declare it to you: wonder and periſh, for I worke a wonderous worke: that is, the bringing forth of God in fleſh.

Now as I ſaid before, when this ſhall be manifeſt, all other glory ſhall fade, the moſt glorious things of all, all our living in formes, as in the 66. of Iſaiah 3. ver. He that kils an Ox, is as if he ſlew a man, he that ſacrificeth a Lamb, is as if he cut off a Dogges neck.
All theſe were things that God commanded under the Law, and the antitype of theſe were under the Goſpell; theſe ſignified ſome thing under the Goſpell: now God when he appeares, he will make theſe not only to be vaine, but vile, as the offering of an Idoll; theſe Ordinances ſhall be revealed ſo to be, when the Lord ſhall appeare: and as our moſt glorious things, our greateſts lights: as in the 60. of Iſa. and the 19.21. Revelation 22. ver. and 22. of Revel. and 5. when God appeares, the Jeruſalem that comes down from above, the holy City, a City not forſaken; this is the appearance of God of God in the Saints: in the 21. Revel. 1-23. I ſaw a new Heaven and a new Earth, and I ſaw the holy City, the new Jeruſalem comming downe from God out of Heaven, prepared as a Bride adorned for her husband: and I heard a voice out of Heaven ſaying, behold the Tabernacle of God is with men, and he will dwell with them, and they ſhall be his people, and G • d himſelfe ſhall be with them, and be their God:
This new Jeruſalem is God manifeſt in the Saints, the fleſh of the Saints, the habitation of God, the tabernacle of God; when this is manifeſt, our moſt glorious things ſhall fade; as in the 22. ver. of this 21. Revel. I ſaw no Temple there, for the Lord God Almighty and the Lamb were the Temple of it, and the City had no need of the Sunne nor the Moone, for the glory of God did lighten it: Yee know the Sunne and the Moone are the ordinary means of light, in the world; ſo our ordinary means of light hath bin the teachings of men; when God appeares, wee ſhall be all taught of God: knowledge ſhall cover the Earth, as water covers the Sea; wee ſhall know God as wee are known: So I ſay, as our moſt glorious things, ſo our confuſions, our darkneſſe, and miſſe-apprehenſions of God, that is contrary to God; and in this his Name ſhall be called wonderfull, the mighty God: his appearance in the Saints, deſtroyes al things beſides him, he is called a conſuming fire, everlaſting burnings; the rod of his mouth, the breath of his noſtrils, ſhall deſtroy all things, that now
hinders a manifeſtation of him, the mighty God: 63. of Iſa. 1. ver. when hee cometh to apeare hee comes travelling in the greatneſſe of his ſtrength, mighty to ſave: when God appeares in the ſaints, hee will make an utter Conſumption of all our Confuſion, and darkneſſe, every battell of the warrier is with a confuſed noiſe, but this ſhall be with burning and fuell of fier: for, unto us a child is born, all our backſlidings, and diſorders, and goings back, our reelings as a drunken man to and fro, 24. Iſai. 19.20.22.23. is not our condition ſuch? now who is it that doeth not reele and ſtagger, and knowes not which way to looke, knows not with what party to ſide? Is not the Earth removed as a cotage, and doth not the Lord viſite the hoſt of the high ones, & gathereth them stogether as into a pitte, as priſoners? all this of the Lord.

when the Lord comes to appear, all theſe our Confuſions and ſtaggerings, ſhall bee Conſumed: 24. Iſai. 23. ver. when the Lord
of hoſts ſhall reign in movnt zion and in Jeruſalem, and before his ancients Gloriouſly. when hee ſhall reign in mount zion, that is, be all in all in the ſaints, they are called The Mountaine of holyneſſe; then will the Lord bring down the noiſe of ſtrangers, as the heate in a dry place, even the heate with the ſhadow of a cloude, and the branch of the terrible ones ſhall bee brought low, and he will deſtroy in this mountain of holyneſſe, the face of the covering, caſt over all people, and the vaile that is ſpread over all nations: whatſoever it be; after the marke in the right hand, or in the forehead, our forms, or uniformities, or our moſt glorious appearances, ſhall fade: and they ſhall deſtroy no more in my holy mountain ſaith the Lord.

Now when God will doe this his worke in the earth, hee will make a ſhort worke of it; as in the 66. of Iſai. 5. ver. Hear the word of the Lord, you that tremble at his word; your brethren that hated you, that caſt you out, for my names ſake, ſaid; let the Lord bee glorious; but hee ſhall appeare to your joy, but they ſhall be
aſhamed▪ that is, that thoſe that waite for the appearane of God in them, that waite for the glory that ſhall be revealed in them, they ſhall be hated of their brethren, they ſhall be hated for my names ſake; thoſe Saints that beare up the name of God, and exalt the name of God, and would have the name of God read in them; they are hated of their brethren.

I beleive the people of God who live in the laſt times, they ſhall be brought into leſſe compaſs then ever they were: it is ſaid; your brethren ſhall hate you: under the law there was the great Iewiſh Church, there a whole Nation were in fellowſhip: afterwards under the Goſpel there were none but ſaints by calling: afterwards, when the ſpirit of Antichriſt came in the night of darknes, and the Apoſtles power was gone, and the power of the beaſt came in with al manner of ſignes & lying wonders, then all the whole world, and Kingdoms were Chriſtians, there was the Church of Rome, and
the Church of Spaine, and the Church of France, and the Church of Scotland, and England, then all were the Church of Chriſt; then, as Reformation came in, the Church grew leſſe and leſſe; then all the world were Popiſh; afterwards wee came to be Proteſtants, and after that propheſſers, then puritanes, and Separatiſts, and then to independants and antinomians; ſo that ſtill the people of God come to bee leſſe and leſſe ſtill in number; ſo I beleive the people of God that walke in the ſpirit, in the laſt times ſhall be fewer then before.

Thoſe that waite for God; for the appearance of God, that wait for the glory of the Sonne to bee revealed in them: theſe are the feweſt that ever were; take all that are one in fellowſhips and judgements, and they are more then thoſe that waite for the glory of God; and therfore thoſe that waite for his appearing are hated of their brethren:

Therfore this is for the comfort of the
Saints: before ſhee travelled, ſhee brought forth, before her paine came, ſhee was delivered▪ the ſenſe I underſtand thus; that thoſe that wait for God, the glory of God to be revealed in them, the Lord will appeare before they bee aware, not only in them, but afterwards in many more: before ſhee travelled ſhee brought forth; that is; unexpectedly and ſuddenly God will appeare before wee be aware, not only in them, but in many more:

This deliverance; before ſhee travelled; is the deliverance of a man-child; it is a bringing forth of Chriſt in us: this is in few words the meaning of it; that Chriſt is in us; Chriſt in our fleſh, God in our fleſh, in every Saint, in the leaſt Saint, there God dwels; although not diſcovered, not manifeſted, yet is the child in the woomb; it is there, and hath a being, thought not brought forth; even ſo God dwels in us though not manifeſted; and when God is manifeſted in our fleſh, then the Man child is brought forth; and this the Lord will doe. It's true, there be ſome that
travell to bring forth Chriſt; and ſome that bee in paine to doe it, but it ſhall not bee ſo with all: for ſome ſhall have Chriſt brought forth in their fleſh before they bee aware: ſee a ſcripture or two; 16, of John, 20. ver. Verily, verily I ſay unto you, that yee ſhall weep and Lament, but the world ſhall rejoyce: and ye ſhall be ſorrowfull, but your ſorrow ſhall be turned into joy. A woman, when she is in travell, hath ſorrow, becauſe her hour is come: but aſſoon as she is delivered of the child, she remembreth no more the auguish, for joy that a man is born into the world. and yee now therefore have ſorrow: but I will ſee you again, and your harts shall rejoyce, and your joy no man taketh from you: the meaning is this; you ſhall ſee Chriſt in the ſpirit; as hee ſaith unto them, in the 16: ver: A little while and yee shall not see me: and again a littile while, and yee shall ſee mee: becauſe I go to the Father: they ſhould in a little while, ſe him; and they ſhould not: what is that? they did not know: but Chriſt ſheweth them, what it was: when Chriſt was in
the fleſh they did ſee him; but when hee was taken out of the fleſh, they did not ſee him; but when Chriſt ſhall come in the ſpirit, they ſhal ſee him again: a little while, & this fleſhly appearance ſhall vaniſh; but afterwards you ſhall ſee me again:

When Chriſt was in the fleſh, they looked upon him as one diſtinct from them, they did not ſee him in their fleſh: they ſhall ſee God in their fleſh, as he was in his fleſh; ſaith Chriſt he that ſeeth me, ſeeth him: thoſe that ſee Chriſt in truth, do not ſee that fleſh only, but God in that fleſh: hee that ſeeth mee, ſeeth the Father: ſo when wee ſee Chriſt truly, we ſee not only that fleſh; but God in that fleſh: now ſaith Chriſt, when I goe a way, the ſpirit shall come: that is in your fleſh: and you shall ſee me again: as in the 16. of John 18, & 20. ver. I Will not leave you comfortleſſe, I will come to you. Yet a little while, and the world ſeeth me no more, but yee ſee me: becauſe I live ye shall live alſo, at that day ye shall know that I am in my Father, and you in me, and I in you.

When Chriſt ſhall come again, wee ſhall know him in the appearance of the Father: the fleſh is nothing, but the manifeſtation of the Father; you ſhall know, that you are in Chriſt, and Chriſt in you: you in mee as I am in the Father: as God was in his fleſh, ſo God ſhall appeare in your fleſh: that God that was manifeſt in his fleſh; ſhall be manifeſt in ours; and that is Chriſt.

Before God was manifeſt in the Diſciples fleſh; Chriſt tould them, they ſhould weepe and lament: but the world shall rejoyce▪ the people of God in theſe times; before God was manifeſted in them, they did ſorrow: before there was the appearance of God in them, we may ſee how ſorrowful they were; they thought that Chriſt had been gon, and that they had loſt their maſter: but ſaith he, I will ſee you again: ſo you ſhall rejoyce; I will ſee you: that is to ſay, that God that was manifeſt in that fleſh, ſhall appeare in yours alſo: again in the 12. of Reve. & the 1. ver. And there appeared a great wonder in Heaven,
a Woman clothed with the Sun, and the moone under her feete, and upon her head a crown of twelve ſtars; and shee beeing with child, cried, travelling in birth, and pained to be delivered. This woman that is here ſpoken of, in Heaven; it is the Saints that are in the ſpirit; even the weakeſt Saints; for God will appeare in the weakeſt Saints:
A woman was traveling, and at length, delivered of a man-child: and in the 5. ver. of the ſame Chap. The child was caught up to God,
The bringing forth of Chriſt, is a bringing forth of God, that is, when God is reveled in us, and appeares in us, and manifeſt in us; there is the man-child:

This is for comfort and for joy, for thoſe that waite for the appearance of God in them: Know this that God will appeare before wee bee aware: this ſhould incourage the people of God, and keepe their harts in remembrance of this truth, that wee are the tabernacles of God, the place where God dwels; as in this book of the Rev. John ſaw
a new Jeruſalem, a City coming downe from above; which is, nothing but God dwelling in us, the City of God, where hee dwelleth:

When God comes to appeare and dwell in us; then ſhall that ſong bee ſung, as it is in the 12. Reve. and the 10. ver. And I heard a loud voice, ſaying in heaven, Now is come ſalvation, and ſtrength, and the kingdom of our God, and the power of his Chriſt; for the accuſer of our brethren is caſt down, which accuſed them before our God day and night.

Now I ſay this ſhould ſpeak comfort to thoſe that wait for the appearance of God, to thoſe that love his appearance, and thoſe that mourne for him: there bee ſome that mourne for his appearance, and ſome that love his appearance: here is comfort for both; for before ſhe traveled ſhe brought forth and before her paine came she was delivered: it is much incouragement; that God, who, is the high and holy one, will appeare before wee bee aware; before her paine came, ſhe was delivred▪ who hath heard ſuch a thing? that
Kingdom ſhould be born at once, ſuddenly and unexſpectedly, God will appeare, not only in us, but in many others.

I know nothing but my owne ſpirit; and ſpeake nothing but my owne experience: I will not lay any exhortation, upon any mans ſpirit: I have been a while, and not long, waiting for the appearance of God; that God might be manifeſted in my fleſh, and doe cry in paine to be belivered: Now in this time, my thoughts are carried out after too many things, and not upon this only, to wait for God; and this hath bin my weakneſſe: I have been and am ſo troubled at what one man, another, and the world will ſay, and how to anſwer all theſe, and the like: I ſay, this is our weakneſſe.

If we could but waite upon God untill he be manifeſt; and then all men ſhall fall for, the loftyneſſe of man ſhall be brought downe and the Lord all one, ſhall bee exalted, in that day: ſee what the prophet ſaith, in the 31. of Jerem. 21. ver. ſet thee up
way-marks, make thee high heaps, ſet thy heart towards the high-way, even the way which thou wenteſt: the meaning is, take away all hinderances: Take away; that is, prepare for God: Then, turne again O! Virgin, daughter of Iſraell; turn again to theſe thy Cities: how long wilt thou goe about? oh, thou back-ſliding daughter: theſe are our back-ſlidings of fleſh, when God is not preſently revealed in us; wee gadde from one thing to another; and our thoughts rove up and downe, and are carefull to anſwer this man and the other; now wee ſhould doe nothing, but turn to God: How long wilt thou goe about, oh, thou back-ſliding daughter.

Behould the Lord hath created a new thing in the earth; a woman shall compas a man; a woman shall; that is, the weakeſt Saint: the Lord hath done it, it is in being already; it is no new thing, but only there wants a manifeſtation of it; the thing is done already; God is come, and hath dwelt in fleſh, and taken it into union already with himſelfe:
A woman ſhall; that is, the weakeſt Saint, ſhall compaſſe Chriſt, the man-child: they ſhall doe it, this is not an uncertain word; but this word, Shall, houlds forth the certainty of it all:

Though a woman, the weaker veſſell, that is the weakeſt Saint; yet there God, and and his greate power will appeare: this ſhould keep our hearts from gadding, wandering, & going about; for God will appeare, hee will manifeſt himſelf: this is for our comfort; that when God ſhall thus appeare, then ſhall that ſpeech be uſed; When I ſhall turn back their Captivity: The Lord bleſs thee, oh, habitation of justice, and mountain of holyneſſe: the Lord bleſſe thee, that is the Saints, who are the habitation of God, and mountain of holineſſe:

Although this proverb be not uſed as yet, it ſhall bee uſed; when he ſhall bring againe their Captivity; that is, when the Lord ſhall appeare and bee manifeſt in us: when the Lord ſhall ariſe to the prey, then they ſhall
confeſſe this; the Lord bleſs thee, oh, thou habitation of justi, and mountain of holyneſs? in whom the holy God dweleth: Vpon this I awaked, and beheld, and my ſleepe was ſweet unto me: it ſeemes the prophet was in a ſleepe, yet hee awaked, and it was very ſweet unto him that God would appeare at laſt:

This is for comfort to thoſe that waite upon God; for his appearance will be before wee bee aware: and I ſay, that as ſurely as God will appeare in us, and manifeſt himſelf in us, ſo he will in many more:

Who hath hard ſuch a thing as this? That A Nation ſhould bee borne at once: we ſhall ſee many companions, that is a comfort to us; all though I confeſſe, were there no man in this world that did waite for God, yet I ſhould be quiet, ſilent and reſt in the lotte: I know the viſion will ſpeake, and will not tarry, it is but for an apointed time; and then God will appeare; till then wee ſhould bee quiet and waite for him, as Chriſt was; hee tels his diſcipees, you ſhal al leave, me but the
Father is with mee; though you doe leave me, yet I have the Father with me, I am not alone: if all the world doe forſake us, yet if God live in us, we ſhall be ſatisfied; but nevertheleſſe, if wee waite upon God in deed, we ſhall ſee more that have the appearance of God in them:

A Nation in one day; 60. Iſa. 2, 3. ver. the the Lord ſhall ariſe on thee, and his Glory ſhall bee ſeen upon thee; and then, the Gentiles ſhall come to thy light, and kings to the brightneſſe of thy riſeing: lift up thy eyes round about; that is when God ſhall appeare in Saints, then many more ſhall come in, and God will appeare in them:

When the name of God ſhall be read upon the Saints, that is the new name; and thou ſhalt be caled by a new name, which the mouth of the Lord ſhall name; and then the Gentiles ſhall ſee thy Righteouſnſs, and all Kings thy glory: that is, they ſhal clearly ſee God in them: Iſa. 61. Chap. 19. ver. where the prophet ſaith, the Lord ſhall bee unto thee an everlasting
light, and thy God thy Glory: Zacha. 3.7. ver. Thus ſaith the Lord of hoſts; if thou wilt walk in my waies, and keep my charge, then thou ſhalt judge my houſe, and I will give thee places to walke in among thoſe that ſtand by; what is that? It is to live in, and walk with God; only to waite for, and upon God; and only to be with God: What is his Courts? The place where God walkes and dwels: If we continually waite for the appeareance of God, and live in him; hee will give us places, or walks among thoſe that judge his houſe, among thoſe that know him and live in him; he wil give us places among the high'ſt, we ſhal be as high with God as any are; there be ſome with God, that live only in God, if we wait upon him, we ſhal be among thoſe, even the highſt: hear now o Joſhuah the high Preiſt, thou and thy fellowes that ſit before thee; for they are men wonder'd at, for behould, I will bring forth my ſervant, the branch.

Heare Oh! Joshuah thou and thy fellowes, that is, Chriſt and thoſe who are Chriſts, are
men wondered at; as the word will beare it, monſtrous men: thoſe that live up to the glory of Chriſt, are men wondered at; but I will bring forth the branch, the man-child: Chriſt; that is the branch: behould God will appear in you, and not only in you, but in many othors alſo: a glorious appearance of God, is a bringing forth of the branch, a bringing forth of Chriſt in us. Iſa. 60. Chap. 14. ver. the ſons of thoſe that afflicted thee, and all they that deſpised thee shall bow themſelves downe at the ſoles of thy feet, and they shall call thee, the City of the Lord, the Zion of the holy one of Iſrael: although Saints may be an afflicted people, a flock troden down, & few; yet God ſhall he ſo manifeſt in them, that they ſhal be called the City of the Lord, the Zion of the holy one of Iſrael; though few, yet a City, and a moſt Glorious City: I will make glorious the place of my feet; the place of Gods reſidents, the glory of Lebannon ſhall bee given unto it, and I will make thee an eternall Exellency, in ſtead of our ordinary light,
teachigs of men; the Lord will be unto us an everlaſting light and thy God thy glory: this glory we waite for, to ſee God dweling in us, that men may ſee us the Tabernacles of God; for God to be our light and our glory, for God to dwell in the light of every one of us, and that all Nations may ſee his ſaving health, or his ſalvation; that we may ſee that light, reaſon, underſtanding and diſcretion, to bee nothing but God; we are apt to think wee had all theſe in us of our owne: Reaſon underſtanding, and wiſdom, are all of the Lord; if we could but ſee it, it is the very appearance of God: Acts. 17.23. That God (ſaith Paul) whom ye ignorantly worship, him declar I unto you: now all the world, in what formes ſoeuer, think they worſhid God; ſome on way, and ſome another: this God (ſaith Paul) I declare, he made the worlds, and he dweleth in no Temple made with hands, nor is worshiped with mens hands, ſeeing hee gives to all breath and life; he is not far from never one of you; if poſſible yee might feele, and find him;
for in him wee live, and move, and have our being. I know many are very zealous to worſhip God, in their way: this God is in us; and they ſhall ſee, when God appeares, that he is not far from every one of us.

And again, as it is comfort to ſee God in us; ſo it is, to ſee God working all things; all things that come to paſſe in the world are of him; our deviſions, earth-quakes, noiſes & thunderings; and our labouring in the fier, that which is moſt weariſom, e is alſo of the Lord; Hab. 2. Chap. 13. ver. Behould, is it not of the Lord of hoſte, that men labour in the fier, and the people ſhall weary themſelves for very vanity: All our crafts, trads, and poliſie, theſe are of the Lord; is it not of the Lord that men labour in the fier, in heate and trouble:

O! how ſweet would this be how calmly ſhould we live; ſeing no thing but God in all theſe actings, controverſies & troubles; it is the Lord: and I thinke the is making an end of the kingdome of he man of ſin; and gloriouſly to appeare himſelf in the Saints,
and to write his name, holyneſs in the earth; in that day there ſhall be upon all actions, & tranſactions, holyneſs to the Lord; and upon the bels of the horſſes, and upon every pot in Jeruſalem; and in that day there ſhall be no more the cananite in the houſe of the Lord; not any thing that is vile or prophane: now to ſee God in all this is much comfort: David when he ſee Gods appearing to him, cries out whom ſhall I feare? the Lord is my light, and my ſalvation, he is the ſtrength of my life; of whom ſhall I be afraid? he doth not ſay, I had life, & light, and ſalvation, given me; but God is my light, and ſtrength of my life: ſo when God appeares, our life ſhall be more vigerous and fuller of God: our ſhadowes, living in our ſelves, and fancies ſhall vaniſh; and we ſhall only ſee our life in God, yea, a well-being in him: this life and glory will appeare, if wee wait for God: before we be aware the noiſe of God will be heard; ariſe my love, my faier one and come away. 85. pſal. 8, 9. ver. I will harken what God the Lord will ſpeake, for
he will ſpeak peace to his people; ſurly his ſalvation is nigh them that feare him, that glory may dwel in our Land. 35. Iſa. 01. ver. and the Redeemed of the Lord ſhall return, & come to Zion with ſongs, and everlaſting joy upon their heads, they ſhall obtain joy & gladnſſe, and ſorrow and ſighing ſhall fly away. and God will bee ſeene to come leaping upon the mountains, and ſkipping upon the hils: and wee ſhall ſee the winter is paſt away, and our darkeſt night to be a clear day; and our glory ſhall be God in us, as floures adorne the earth: the time of rejoycing ſhall bee as the ſinging of birds in the ſpring, & the noiſe of the turtle ſhall be heard in our Land; even groanings of love: oh! bleſſed are they that waite for God, and the pure in hart, for they shall ſee God: they that waite upon God shall underſtand; thoſe that wait ſince the daily ſacrifice hath been taken away, till the end of the time that this abomination which makes deſolate is ſet up, bleſſed is he that waits til the end, for hee shall reſt, and ſtand in the lot at the end
of the dayes: and when God is manifeſt, it ſhall be ſaid in that day, Loe this is our God, wee have waited for him, hee shall ſave us; this is the Lord, wee have waited for him, wee will be glad and erjoice in his ſalvation.

q.hi: Sing oh! daughter of Zion, shout oh Iſrael! bee glad and rejoice, with all thy hart; oh daughter of Jeruſalem, for the LORD, thy GOD, is in the mideſt of thee.
